results.title: Jules Verne
results.brief_description:
Jules Verne had three passions in life: the sea, music and freedom. The passion for the sea started during his childhood in Nantes, in the Quartier de l’Ile Feydeau, filled with memeories of explorers and slave traders. Destined to become a lawyer, Verne is sent to Paris where he begins to write. His writings are highly influenced by the industrial revolution and the belief in the power of the machine to transform the world.

Credits: Director, Jean Vidal ; writer, Yolande Cassin.
Cast: Daniel Ivernel [narration only].

results.title: Judy Grinham
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “British Sporting Personalities”.
The swimming career of Judy Grinham turned on her decision, when only twelve years of age, to concentrate on her backstroke, and on her partnership with the great swimming coach, Reg Laxton. Shows her racing performance in the 1956 Melbourne Olympics and the 1958 Commonwealth Games and a glimpse of her private life as well.

results.title: Judoka
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow, Bernard Devlin and Josef Reeve
results.brief_description: The unusual story of a young Canadian athlete, Doug Rogers, who developed, in Japan, a talent for judo that led him into competition for the world championship at the Tokyo Olympics and subsequent competition at the Pan-American Games. The film shows the intensive judo training Rogers took at a Tokyo college, as well as glimpses of his life in Japan.

results.title: Judo
results.brief_description: Gives details of the sport of Judo which has become most popular in the western world in recent years. Judo is the Japanese art of self-defence or unarmed combat and its specialised techniques are a co-ordination of mind and body in a highly refined and effective way.

results.title: Judging people
results.creator_credit: Leon S. Gold, Roundtable Productions and Arthur Swerdloff
results.brief_description: Shows frequent pitfalls in sizing up people, as well as methods of avoiding mistakes in making decisions about people, and predicting their performance. Tells how to improve one’s ability to analyze and judge personality, intelligence, ability and capacity.

results.title: Jude the Obscure
results.creator_credit: Martin Lismore, BBC and Hugh David
results.brief_description: A television adaptation of Thomas Hardy’s novel which tells the story of the doomed Jude Fawley, a bright but poor stonemason. Trapped into marriage with Bella he is unable to realise his ambitions of education at Christminster. When Bella leaves him for Australia he meets his cousin Sue with whom he begins a long and tortuous relationship with tragic consequences, seeming to realise his aunt’s belief that marriage and the Fawley’s are not a possible combination. Stars Robert Powell, Alex Marshall and Fiona Walker.

results.title: Jude's case (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Jude is a conscientious researcher in a professional market research team. Her supervisor wants her to be more creative and she is shocked and resentful at his feedback. Peter Quarry assumes the role of supervisor and uses the 3 step approach.
